summary:
"Now kiss her!"
"Yeah."
"Just kidding."
"God it looked like Ned and Catelyn!"
"Yeah that's true."
Y'ALL I'M LIVING FOR THE...
body:
“Now kiss her!”

“Yeah.”

“Just kidding.”

“God it looked like Ned and Catelyn!”

“Yeah that’s true.”

summary: Not sure if this has been asked but besides Sansa who’s your favorite GOT female character? Who’s your favorite GOT male...
question: Not sure if this has been asked but besides Sansa who’s your favorite GOT female character? Who’s your favorite GOT male character? Are you excited for the final season ending for your favorite characters including Sansa if they’re alive? Thoughts? Thx.
answer:
GoT only or ASOIAF? I’ll go with GoT.

Favourite female characters:

  1. Sansa Stark
  2. Cersei Lannister
  3. Catelyn Stark
  4. I like Shae a lot too

Favourite male characters:

  1. Theon Greyjoy
  2. Stannis Baratheon
  3. Doran Martell
  4. Bran Stark

I am excited for the ending because I’m 100% sure Sansa and Bran are surviving but I’m convinced Cersei will get a horrible storyline. If Theon dies for Yara I’ll fight D&D with my bare hands. 

Honestly most of my excitement is seeing theories I support validated (Dark Dany, Dance of Dragons 2.0, Queen Sansa) but I can already tell there’ll be garbage than I can stand so it’s a mixed bag for me

summary: "Aren't you afraid of my darkness, my dear? Hades asked with mischief in his eyes. 'No,' Persephone replied, 'You haven't even...
body:
“Aren’t you afraid of my darkness, my dear? Hades asked with mischief in his eyes. ‘No,’ Persephone replied, 'You haven’t even seen mine yet. ”

Sansa Stark - Persephone

title: @ got writers
body: hey, you cowards, instead of pitting dany and sansa against each other all season the same time you are COUNTER ENFORCING THERE IS NO TIME FOR ANYTHING BUT THE WAR, use the time!! for them!!! to bond over their shared experiences!!!! the domestic abuse they’ve gone through!!!! the sexual abuse!!!!! the feeling!!!!!!! of!!!!!!!!! never!!!!! having!!!!!!! a true!!!!!!!! home!!!!!! please please PLEASE you make us watch them go through all this shit and for what??????????????? literally for what??????????? i cant even think of a made-up reason!!!!!!!!!!!! let them talk about losing Lady and Viserion to unfair circumstances and realize how alike in style they can be and try different hairstyles on eachother because they never had a friend that was a girl besides Margery and Missandei and THEY COULD HAVE SUCH A GOOD. REFRESHING FRIENDSHIP IF. YOU. LET. GO. OF THE UNNEEDED DRAMA.

summary: Jon's Lady with a Good Heart
body:
Jon’s Lady with a Good Heart

I just realized that Jon Snow’s comment of “ She has a good heart” somehow can actually point to a chapter in Sansa’s POV in A Storm of Swords

““You have a good heart, my lady,” she said to Sansa. “Not every maid would weep so for a man who set her aside and wed her to a dwarf.”

A good heart. I have a good heart. Hysterical laughter rose up her gullet, but Sansa choked it back down. The bells were ringing, slow and mournful. Ringing, ringing, ringing. They had rung for King Robert the same way. Joffrey was dead, he was dead, he was dead, dead, dead. Why was she crying, when she wanted to dance? Were they tears of joy?”

This scene leads up to one of my favorite quotes for Sansa and also one of her iconic lines in the books

“My skin has turned to porcelain, to ivory, to steel”

Sansa described herself this iconic line but even so while I was reading the chapter I realized that she is both those quotes…

Sansa indeed has a good heart and that she has also been forged through the worst fires Westeros could churn up and she had come out of it alive and has become a well crafted steel, a well crafted sword… In this Chapter, the mentioned of “GAME OF THRONES” to Sansa also happens, like a foreshadowing of what is to come which is that Sansa is very much a strong player now in this game with her having been a “pawn” that led to the death of a king…

And in the show on S7 she really owned up to being Queen when she finally with Arya being her Hand, executed Littlefinger, the person who was the mastermind of all the bad things that ever happened to her family…

Come Season 8, everyone and I mean everyone will finally realized that the “pawn” has killed the “Bishop” ( Littlefinger) and has now become QUEEN ready to protect THE hidden KING (Jon Snow).

Sansa’s chapters in the books are really filled with these wonderful wonderful nuggets of foreshadowing and I always enjoy them…

1 more day…

blog.name: gaystannis
blog.title: stan dorne
blog.description: I’m Lee and this is where I post asoiaf art and go hog wild (main is hoerrormovie)

question: top 5 sansa hcs??
answer:
1. there’s that scene where jon remembers how sansa told him to tell girls that they have pretty names. i like to imagine that she was always trying to give him little lessons and advice on courtesy and how to be a proper knight

2. bran and arya would make her be the distraction when they stole food from the kitchens. she would only do it on the condition that they stole extra lemoncakes for her 

3. she used to use arya’s hair to practice braiding on but arya was really bad at sitting still so she got jon and bran to do it instead because they were the least hyperactive. also if you were still for even a minute sansa would pounce on you and braid flowers into your hair. even ned wasn’t spared and one time he showed up to a meeting with daisies in his beard. he rocked it though 

4. as we know she was super into knights and tourneys and other southern customs. one time for her nameday catelyn helped her sew favors that they gave to robb, jon, theon, and jory and made them stage a little four person tourney in the practice yard. jory won and crowned sansa queen of love and beauty and she was on cloud nine for days 

5. she’s also not straight but she thought that when she admired other girls she just wanted to be like them. and it isn’t until the vale where she meets mya stone that she realizes “wait i don’t want to be a boyish mule keeper but i still admire her and think about her a lot what’s going on?” and has a bi awakening

summary: tvline: 31 hours and 41 minutes until these two (and a few others) are back on our screens for the final season of...
caption:
tvline: 31 hours and 41 minutes until these two (and a few others) are back on our screens for the final season of #GameOfThrones. Deep breaths. Patience is a virtue.

Maisie Williams and Sophie Turner promoting Game of Thrones Season 8 in New York City, April 2, 2019.

blog.name: the-bitchet
blog.title: I'm ready to suffer and I'm ready to hope

tags: if you think this has a happy ending blah blah blah
summary: I'm in a weird place with the Game of Thrones fandom because I am a Jonsa but I don't think there's a snowball's chance in hell...
body:
I’m in a weird place with the Game of Thrones fandom because I am a Jonsa but I don’t think there’s a snowball’s chance in hell of it being canon either in the show or the books.

If I’m being honestly I’ve been shipping it since at least Season 5 and that’s not a typo. I was originally hopeful about Sansa’s S5 storyline because S4 was so strong and because I knew where Jeyne’s story was headed in the books. I didn’t expect Littlefinger to bounce so quickly and let Sansa actually marry Ramsay but I did see it as a chance for Sansa to win back Winterfell, have some romanticish moment with Jon coming to rescue her, and for a truly epic take on the Northern Conspiracy.

And that last part? About the Northern Conspiracy? That’s why I have no hope that Jonsa is ever going to be on even though I was right about a lot of things and so were many other people. The show’s Northern Conspiracy was one old woman. And I kept hoping that wasn’t the case, that the Umbers were double-crossing Ramsay, that there really was a plan instead of Dumb and Dumber putting up spectacle after spectacle without any coherent plan or guiding purpose.

But nope. Just like they bungled Dorne and their conspiracy, just like the entire mess that was the Stark Kids vs. Littlefinger in S7, Dumb and Dumber really had the Umbers betray the Starks like that because they’re all flash and no substance. They can’t do conspiracies, they can’t do intrigue, they can’t do subtle?

Jon shows no sign of being in love with Daenerys? Maybe he feels awkward because he and EC allegedly had a fling back in the start of the show. (This is not a pro-Kimilia account so don’t start.) Or maybe KH is just a weak actor and the only reason Jon/Ygritte worked was because of RL’s charisma and the chemistry between the two actors. Take your pick. Speaking of Ygritte, I’m pretty sure the idea is that like with Ygritte, Jon has his own motives with Dany but eventually falls in love. The songs they picked for their Spotify playlist? “Sister” is probably Jaime/Cersei and “Girl From the North Country” could be Jon/Ygritte, Gendry/Arya, or most likely Sam/Gilly as I do expect them to get married and probably be the only wedding next season. The original triangle of Jon/Arya/Tyrion? It’s probably been replaced with Jon/Dany/Tyrion and that plays into Frikidoctor’s leaks regarding Tyrion’s fate. The Ashford Tourney Theory? Applies more to the books and is already a stretch as it includes the attempted betrothal to Willas/Loras but doesn’t mention the similar attempted betrothal to Robert/Robyn Arryn and it ignores her marriage to Ramsay Bolton in the show. Liam Cunningham liked a Jonsa vid? I’m old enough to remember when Lena Headey posted a picture on her Instagram of a heart made out of rocks with the title “my stone heart”. This was right before the S4 episode called “Oathkeeper” a clear and obvious reference to Brienne who had made an oath to whom? That’s right. Even when Lady Stoneheart did not appear, we kept hope all through the season. Reddit was hyped for the S4 finale , “The Children” because surely that was when they’d introduce Lady Stoneheart right? Right??

Right. So while I’m a slow learner but I do learn. This show is never that smart or that deep. I’m now just hoping for the survival of the remaining Starks, Jon Snow, the direwolves, and Winterfell. Maybe a few references to Cat and Rickon too and for someone to remind Jon that the last King in the North was Robb. If we’re really lucky we’ll get at an ambiguous ending with Jon and Sansa ruling together and casual fans can think it’s a Narnia situation and we can pretend they’re married.

But anything more than that? Not even going to hope for it.
